item.title: Claudette add a quote by William Carlos Williams
item.description: "Outside, the north wind, coming and passing, swelling and dying, lifts the frozen sand drives it a-rattle against the lidless windows and we may dear sit stroking the cat stroking the cat and smiling sleepily, prrrr." -- William Carlos Williams

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description:
"I went to bed and woke in the middle of the night thinking I heard someone cry, thinking I myself was weeping, and I felt my face and it was dry.
Then I looked at the window and thought: Why, yes, it's just the rain, the rain, always the rain, and turned over, sadder still, and fumbled about for my dripping sleep and tried to slip it back on." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "We are cups, constantly and quietly being filled. The trick is, knowing how to tip ourselves over and let the beautiful stuff out." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Don't think. Thinking is the enemy of creativity. It's self-conscious and anything self-conscious is lousy. You can't "try" to do things. You simply "must" do things." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Jeffrey McDaniel
item.description: "Even when I'm dead, I'll swim through the Earth, like a mermaid of the soil, just to be next to your bones." -- Jeffrey McDaniel

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Jess C. Scott
item.description: "When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You know that your name is safe in their mouth." -- Jess C. Scott

item.title: Claudette add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "There are two tragedies in life. One is to lose your heart's desire. The other is to gain it." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Scott Westerfeld
item.description: "I expect that you must receive top marks at school, young lady." Madeleine smiled as she stirred her tea. "There are always rewards for those who state the obvious frequently and with conviction." -- Scott Westerfeld

item.title: Claudette add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "There are two basic motivating forces: fear and love. When we are afraid, we pull back from life. When we are in love, we open to all that life has to offer with passion, excitement, and acceptance. We need to learn to love ourselves first, in all our glory and our imperfections. If we cannot love ourselves, we cannot fully open to our ability to love others or our potential to create. Evolution and all hopes for a better world rest in the fearlessness and open-hearted vision of people who embrace life." -- John Lennon

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "I'm not afraid of death; I just don't want to be there when it happens." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Claudette add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Claudette add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw
